DOC.brief_summary: Aims study assess difference CFV/CFR ( Coronary flow velocity/reserve ) diabetic vs. non-diabetic patient correlate CK-MB , TnI HsCRP release otherwise successful coronary stenting .
DOC.brief_title: Prediction CK-MB Release During Otherwise Successful Stenting Procedure
DOC.detailed_description: Post-procedure CK-MB troponin I ( TnI ) HsCRP elevation , absence obvious procedural event , likely cause distal micro-thromboembolism platelet aggregate atheromatous debris cause microvascular bed obstruction . This , turn , result low coronary flow reserve regional left ventricular ( LV ) dysfunction . Therefore , patient normal CFV/CFR ( coronary flow velocity/reserve ) Doppler wire FFR ( fractional flow reserve ) flow wire peri-procedural CK-MB , TnI elevation compare patient peri-procedural CK-MB TnI elevation marker microcirculation reduce . This observation prognostic value short long-term . This study may also clinical implication patient intra-coronary stenting normal microvascular parameter post PCI patient may discharge early others may need monitor in-hospital extended period time .
DOC.criteria: Patients > 18 year age Stable patient undergo PCI ( intent stent ) Patients de novo type B2/C lesion native coronary vessel Patients acute myocardial infarction ( Q wave nonQ wave CKMB 5 time upper normal [ 80 U/L ] within 72 hour ) Patients cardiogenic shock Patients restenotic lesion Patients type A type B1 lesion native coronary vessel Patients require use atherectomy device PCI Patients elevate CKMB ( > 16 U/L ) TnI ( > 2ng/L ) baseline Patients receive tirofiban eptifibatide infusion within 24 hour PCI Patients know allergy abciximab adenosine Patients platelet count < 100,000 cell/mm3 Patients comorbidity reduce life expectancy one year Patients currently participate another investigational drug/device study
